items.sentence: I\'ll go for a walk if the weather improves.
I\'ll go tell the others what we need to do.
I\'ll go to Boston next summer to visit Tom.
I\'ll have to catch the 8:15 train to Paris.
I\'ll help you raise money for your charity.
It\'ll take three hours to make the changes.
It\'s a small town in the middle of nowhere.
Tom keeps every letter his mother sends him.
Tom knows better than to disagree with Mary.
Tom listens to French podcasts all the time.
Tom has been arrested more than three times.
Tom has been told what to do more than once.
Tom has much more experience than Mary does.
Tom has no idea how Mary ended up in Boston.
Tom has probably already gone to bed by now.
Why don\'t you have a try at convincing Tom?
Why don\'t you just go back and talk to Tom?
Why don\'t you sit and have a drink with me?
Why don\'t you sit right there on the couch?
Why don\'t you stay with us for a few weeks?
